intro: Boechera falcifructa, commonly known as the hooked-fruit rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of elliptic, glaucous leaves and small, white, cruciform flowers. Boechera falcifructa typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its fruit is a capsule that curves downward, giving it the common name "hooked-fruit."
